p.s: As mentioned in the summary is the extract of the speech about how important school exchanges are when you want to break down certain walls between people from all over the world.
The extract is structured in four different paragraphs.
The first one says why he is there, in the second one he talks about how young americansAmericans already connectsconnect.
The third one shows why exchanges are important and the fourth is a request/invitation, so the extract is divided into different parts of one topic.
Obama uses when he speaks in lines 14-17 about progress the pronoun we, with this he wants to include the listeners and also to raise attention.
In lines 18 to 22 he uses the pronoun you, which has ana similar effect, Obama wants to emphatizeemphasize on how important it is for every person to build bridges instead of building new walls.
This also raises the attention of the listener, you are spoken to directly.
Obama uses a certain metaphor a few times in his speech walls (l. 13) or build new bridges instead of building new walls.
With this stylistic advice he wants to make this more clear, because if you stand before a wall you can notcannot get to another person or even hear another person behind that wall.
While if you would say as an example barrier it is not as clear, because a barrier is a lot of time easier to break those than a wall, also a wall is a clearer picture.
In lines 18-20 you can find anophoraanaphora as well as parallelism, all the sentences begin with You can.
This emphaticesemphasizes that is for everyone but especially for you possible to do this.
It marks how important it is with the use of the pronoun you.
It also raises the attention of the listener and motivates yoyou to do everything that he tells you to.
All in all Obama uses certain stylistic devices as an example metaphor or anaphora and pronouns like you or we to speak to the listener directly.
